meta.title: Frames – Film Photography App for Analog Notes & Metadata
meta.description: Frames is a film photography app for analog photographers. Log every shot, track camera settings, organize rolls, and save EXIF metadata on iPhone & Mac.

company.description: Frames is an iOS and macOS app that helps film photographers log, organize, and track their analogue photography process.

hero.heading_seo: Frames Film Photography App: Notes and Metadata for Analog Photography
hero.heading:
The essential photography notebook,
designed for analog shooters.

hero.alt: Frames film photography app and analog photography app for Mac and iPhone, designed to log film rolls, manage metadata, and archive analog photos.

hero_mobile.alt: Frames film photography app and analog photography app for Mac and iPhone, designed to log film rolls, manage metadata, and archive analog photos.

preview1.alt: Frames film photography app and analog photography app showing the recorder interface with shutter speed and aperture selection for logging film exposures.

preview2.alt: Frames analog photography app displaying detailed metadata options including exposure, film stock, camera, lens, and shooting conditions for film photographers.

preview3.alt: Frames film photography app on macOS showing organized film rolls in the library view when browsing folders of analog photos.

preview4.alt: Frames analog photography app presenting gear settings with camera, lens, and filter details to manage analog photography equipment.

preview5.alt: Frames film photography app exporting data as .frames, .txt, or .gpx files for backing up and sharing analog photography logs and metadata.

preview6.alt: Frames analog photography app metadata integrated with Finder, Adobe Lightroom, Adobe Bridge, Google Photos, Darktable, and Flickr for film photographers.

reviews.heading: What Users Say About Our Film Photography App

review1.title: Reliable Film Photography App That Transfers Shooting Data
review1.quote: Easy to use, reliable, and fairly priced app that transfers shooting data, including geolocation, into scanned negatives' EXIF. The developer listens to feedback and keeps improving. Excellent!

review2.title: Perfect App for Logging Film Shots and Replacing Notebooks
review2.quote: As a home-developing film photographer, I love how Frames lets me log every shot without the hassle of notebooks. It is the perfect and practical solution. Went Pro and never looked back!

review3.title: Track Exposure and Location Data Easily When Shooting Film
review3.quote: Great for recording exposure and location when shooting film, ideal for analyzing settings or keeping EXIF-style data. The developer fixed a bug within a day. Highly recommended!

review4.title: Frames Keeps Film Photographers Organized and Mindful
review4.quote: Getting back into film, I missed having metadata until I found Frames. It replaces paper notes, helps me stay organized, and keeps me mindful when shooting. A must-have for film photographers!

review5.title: Clean, Simple, and the Best Film Notes App I’ve Used
review5.quote: You can tell the developer uses the app too. Every small detail feels intentional, and the interface is clean and simple. Everything works smoothly. Easily the best film notes app available!

review6.title: Fast, Private, and Feature-Rich Analog Photography App
review6.quote: The best analog photography app I’ve used so far. It is simple, fast, and includes all the features I really need for organizing my work. No ads, no tracking, and privacy is a major plus.

review7.title: Elegant and Well-Crafted App for Managing Film Rolls
review7.quote: The app is simple and does exactly what it should. I love being able to name my current film rolls since I sometimes forget which camera I used. The UI is clean, elegant, and well-crafted.

details.description1: Designed with feedback from the film community to make data logging clear and enjoyable.
details.description2: Join thousands of photographers bringing order and insight to their film shooting experience with Frames.

feature1.label: Archive
feature1.title: Organize Library
feature1.description: Browse, organize, and manage all your film rolls effortlessly, keeping each session clearly structured, easy to find, and perfectly organized.

feature2.label: Equipment
feature2.title: Manage Gears
feature2.description: Keep a detailed record of your cameras, lenses, and filters to stay consistent and have all your gear info ready for each shoot.

feature3.label: Record
feature3.title: Capture Settings
feature3.description: Log aperture, shutter speed, film stock, and location details instantly for each frame, keeping every shot’s information accurate and accessible.

feature4.label: History
feature4.title: Revisit Shots
feature4.description: Look back at your logged rolls to review settings, analyze previous sessions, learn from them, and refine your film photography workflow.

feature5.label: Exports
feature5.title: Export Records
feature5.description: Save or share your records as .frames, .txt, or .gpx files for backup, sharing, or integrating your data with other apps or workflows.

feature6.label: Metadata
feature6.title: Save Metadata
feature6.description: Embed all recorded data into scanned images to preserve analog information while keeping your digital archives fully synchronized.

feature7.label: Support
feature7.title: Email Support
feature7.description: Reach out directly to the developer for help, share feedback, or suggest new features and improvements anytime, with quick responses.

question1.question: What metadata can I record?
question1.answer: Frames lets you log detailed information for every shot, including camera, lens, filters, frame number, focal length, aperture, shutter speed, ISO, metering mode, film stock, flash, GPS location, timestamps, and custom notes, ensuring you never lose track of important analog photography details.

question2.question: Which image formats are supported?
question2.answer: Frames supports JPEG, TIFF, and DNG formats, allowing you to embed your recorded metadata directly into scanned analog photos for seamless organization and workflow across your devices.

question3.question: Is Frames on Android or Windows?
question3.answer: Frames is currently available for iPhone and macOS. Versions for Android and Windows are planned for 2026, and in the meantime, you can share and manage your data via .frames file exports.

question4.question: Which shutter speeds and apertures are supported?
question4.answer: Frames provides default sequences that cover most lenses and cameras, and you can also define custom sequences for your gear, making it compatible with any shutter speed or aperture values.

question5.question: Can I log tripods or accessories?
question5.answer: Yes, Frames lets you record tripods, flashes, and other accessories. There’s also an extra note field where you can add any custom details you want.

question6.question: What are the plans for future updates?
question6.answer: Future plans include expanding workflow features, improving integration across devices, and adding new tools requested by the community to make analog photography logging even more flexible and powerful.

contact.heading: Let’s hear your ideas and thoughts.

video.title: Film Photography App to Log & Track Your Rolls (Frames for iPhone)
video.description: Discover Frames, the dedicated film photography app designed for analog shooters. Frames makes managing your analog photography effortless, helping you record not only your shots but also the story behind every roll and frame. Whether you work with 35mm, medium format, or large format film, Frames keeps your workflow organized and ensures your photo metadata stays with your images, even after scanning.

meta.title: Privacy Policy - Frames
meta.description: Read the privacy policy for Frames, the analog photography notebook app. Learn how we handle your data with care on both mobile and desktop.

section1.heading: Introduction
section1.paragraph1: At Frames, your privacy is our priority. This Privacy Policy explains how we handle information across our iOS and macOS apps as well as our website. We are committed to keeping your data secure, transparent, and under your control. No unnecessary tracking or collection occurs, and you always remain in charge of the information you choose to share or export.

section2.heading: Frames for iOS and macOS
section2.paragraph1a: Frames does not collect, store, or share any personal data.
section2.paragraph1b: All information you enter in the app is stored locally on your device and never transmitted to any server or third party.
section2.paragraph2: The app uses Apple’s StoreKit framework to manage subscriptions. This process is handled entirely by Apple, and no personal information is accessible to the developer.
section2.paragraph3: Frames does not include analytics, tracking, or any online services. It makes no network connections except when using the system’s location service (CLLocationManager) to capture GPS coordinates if you choose to record them.
section2.paragraph4: When exporting data, the app may create .frames, .txt, or .gpx files. Sharing these files through the system share menu is entirely under your control. The developer does not access or track exported content.
section2.paragraph5: Frames requests the following system permissions:

line1.title: Camera
line1.description: to take a picture directly from the app.

line2.title: Photos
line2.description: to select reference images from your library.

line3.title: Location (While Using the App)
line3.description: to record your GPS coordinates when capturing frames.

section3.heading: withframes.com Website
section3.paragraph1a: The Frames website is a static site hosted on GitHub Pages.
section3.paragraph1b: It does not use cookies, analytics, or tracking scripts. No personal data is collected or stored.
section3.paragraph2: Cloudflare provides basic, anonymous traffic statistics based on server logs. These logs contain no personally identifiable information and are not used for profiling or marketing.
section3.paragraph3: The site includes outbound links to external websites and social media platforms for sharing content or acknowledging publications. Visiting those sites is optional and subject to their own privacy policies.
section3.paragraph4: No forms, newsletters, or interactive features collect information on this website.

section4.heading: Contacting us
section4.paragraph1: If you have any questions or concerns about this privacy policy, you can reach the developer at:
